title: I.Sicily inscription 001130
support: A marble plaque, intact except at the upper right corner.

layout.p: Seven lines of Greek letters, filling the face, with a regular left margin, the final line approximately centred; the text is engraved by means of individual dots punched with a rounded tool.

handNote.lettering: Regular neatly cut letters, with pronounced terminations to the strokes. Alpha has broken bar; beta a much smaller upper eye, just closed; epsilon has nearly equal strokes; zeta formed by vertical with horizontal top and bottom; kappa has shortened arms; mu has midstrokes descending only half-way, curved rather than angular, and not always reaching the top of the verticals; xsi formed by three horizontals only, the middle one shorter; omicron is full size; pi has horizontal extending beyond the verticals; sigma has horizontal top and bottom strokes; phi is standard height, with ovoid eye; omega is closed, and tear-drop shaped.

provenanceFound._: Found in excavations of the so-called 'Gymnasium' (a private house) in 1865, at Solunto

provenanceObserved._: On display on the wall of the courtyard of the Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
